title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in Galle, Matara and Mannar districts after 2.00 p.m.

title: Trump, Zelenskiy pledge in phone call to work for end to war in Ukraine
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy agreed on Wednesday to work together to end Russia’s war with Ukraine, in what the White House described as a “fantastic” one-hour phone call.

title: 2025 LG Polls: Accepting nominations concludes
byline: The acceptance of nominations for the upcoming Local Government (LG) Elections will conclude today (20).

title: Gazette issued amending import and export regulations
byline: A Gazette Extraordinary has been issued amending multiple import and export regulations, including a key change allowing Bureau Veritas inspection certificates for vehicles imported from all countries.

title: Over 1,500 armed forces deserters arrested
byline: More than 1,500 deserters from the Tri-Forces have been arrested for failing to report for duty without being legally discharged.

title: Train collides with stalled vehicle, disrupting services on Kelani Valley line
byline: A train has collided with a vehicle that had stalled at the railway crossing between Liyanwala and Watareka, disrupting services on the Kelani Valley railway line, according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Ex-IGP Deshabandu to be produced in court today
byline: Former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who is currently in remand custody, is scheduled to be produced before the Matara Magistrate’s Court again today (20).

title: HIP successfully discharges second batch of vehicles for domestic market
byline: Hambantota International Port (HIP) has successfully discharged its second batch of vehicles for the domestic market last week, continuing to strengthen its role as a key hub for automotive shipments.

title: ‘Tentigo’ becomes first Sri Lankan black comedy remade in multiple languages
byline: A 2023 Sinhala-language black comedy film, Tentigo (Nelum Kuluna) directed by Ilango Ram and produced by Hiranya Perera under Silent Frames Productions, has made waves in the international film scene.

title: Colombo HC rejects request to lift freeze order on Keheliya’s bank account
byline: The Colombo High Court has rejected a request made by the attorneys of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella to lift the order freezing his bank account in the parliamentary branch, in connection with an ongoing investigation by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: 2025 LG Elections nominations close
byline: The acceptance of nominations for the upcoming Local Government Elections has officially ended a short while ago.

title: Sri Lanka’s LG Election scheduled for May 06
byline: The Election Commission has announced that the upcoming Local Government (LG) Elections in Sri Lanka will be held on May 06.

title: Adani Green Energy refutes claims of pricing revision in Sri Lanka project
byline: India’s Adani Green Energy Limited (AGEL) has strongly denied recent speculation regarding alleged changes to its renewable energy agreement in Sri Lanka.

title: Former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon further remanded
byline: The former Inspector General of Police (IGP), Deshabandu Tennakoon has been ordered to be further remanded until April 03 by the Matara Magistrate’s Court.

title: Elon Musk’s X sues Indian govt over alleged censorship, IT Act violations
byline: Social media giant ‘X’ (formerly Twitter), owned by US billionaire Elon Musk, has filed a lawsuit in the Karnataka High Court against Government of India, challenging what it called unlawful content regulation and arbitrary censorship.

title: At least 70 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes across Gaza, health authorities say
byline: At least 70 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded in Israeli airstrikes across Gaza on Thursday after Israel resumed its bombing campaign and ground operations in the enclave, a Gaza health official said.
